teamstoolkit.accountTree.azureAccountToo:
AZURE ACCOUNT  
The Teams Toolkit may require an Azure subscription to deploy the Azure resources for your project.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.m365AccountTool:
Microsoft 365 ACCOUNT  
The Teams Toolkit requires an Microsoft 365 organizational account where Teams is running and has been registered.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.noSubscriptions: You have no subscriptions. You can't provision or deploy your resources to Azure!
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingMess: [Sideloading](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/concepts/build-and-test/prepare-your-o365-tenant#enable-custom-teams-apps-and-turn-on-custom-app-uploading) is disabled in your Microsoft 365 account. teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.pre:
Validate and install prerequisites.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-check-prerequisites-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.tab:
Set up tab.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-debug-set-up-tab-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.bot:
Set up bot.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-debug-set-up-bot-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.sso:
Set up SSO.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-debug-set-up-sso-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.man:
Build and upload Teams manifest.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-debug-prepare-manifest-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.prereq: Sign-in prompt for Microsoft 365 account, then validate if the account enables the sideloading permission.
Install localhost SSL certificate. It's used to serve the development sites over HTTPS to debug the Tab app in Teams.
Install Azure Functions Core Tools. It's used to serve Azure Functions hosted project locally.
Install Ngrok. Bot project requires a public message endpoint, and ngrok can help create public tunnel for your local service.
Ensure .NET Core SDK is installed. TeamsFx Azure Functions project depends on extra .NET binding extensions for HTTP trigger authorization.
Validate available ports to ensure those debug ones are not occupied.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.projec: The current working directory of the npm install script.
The arguments passed to the npm install command.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.forceU: Always run npm install script or not.
false: only install when dependency changes.
true: always run npm install script.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.ngrokA: The arguments passed to the ngrok install command.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.ngrokP:
The ngrok path.
If undefined, use Teams Toolkit ngrok, otherwise use provided ngrok.
e.g."ngrokPath": "ngrok" | "C:/sample/path/ngrok" | "./bot/node_modules/ngrok/bin/ngrok"
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.tunnel:
Tunnel inspection.
If undefined, get endpoint from log first, then the first PublicURL from default inspection "http://127.0.0.1:4040/api/tunnels"
Otherwise, use provided inspection (the first PublicURL).
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.npm:
Install npm packages.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-npm-package-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.command.sta:
Start the local tunnel service.
 See https://aka.ms/teamsfx-local-tunnel-task for how to customize following args.
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.tab.ba: The base url that the Tab app will be hosted on
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.bot.bo: The AAD app client id for bot
The AAD app client secret for bot
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.sso.ob: The AAD app object id for SSO
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.sso.cl: The AAD app client id for SSO
The AAD app client secret for SSO
teamstoolkit.taskDefinitions.args.sso.ac: The AAD app access_as_user scope id for SSO
